qas.question: Where was Napoleon put under house arrest?
What historical event brought about the fall of the Robespierres?
When did the Thermidorian Reaction take place?
At the time of his house arrest, Napoleon was serving with what military entity?
After his house arrest, who was the commissar that Napoleon sent a letter to protesting innocence?

context: Some contemporaries alleged that Bonaparte was put under house arrest at <a0_0>Nice<a0_0/> for his association with the Robespierres following their fall in <a1_0>the Thermidorian Reaction<a1_0/> in <a2_0>July 1794<a2_0/>, but Napoleon's secretary Bourrienne disputed the allegation in his memoirs. According to Bourrienne, jealousy was responsible, between the Army of the Alps and <a3_0>the Army of Italy<a3_0/> (with whom Napoleon was seconded at the time). Bonaparte dispatched an impassioned defense in a letter to the commissar <a4_0>Salicetti<a4_0/>, and he was subsequently acquitted of any wrongdoing.
